text: Tadoussac is a Canadian drama film, directed by Martin Laroche and released in 2017."Tadoussac – Film de Martin Laroche". Films du Québec, November 26, 2017. The film stars Camille Mongeau as Chloé, an unhappy young woman from Montreal who abandons her urban life and travels to the small town of Tadoussac, where she befriends Myriam (Isabelle Blais), a local tour guide who is battling emotional demons of her own."Tadoussac: quête viscérale". La Presse, December 1, 2017. The cast also includes Isabelle Boivin, Serge Boulianne and Juliette Gosselin. The film was shot in 2016, in Tadoussac and other areas in the Côte- Nord region of Quebec."Tournage du film Tadoussac sur la Haute-Côte-Nord". Ici Radio-Canada, March 18, 2016. The film premiered in September 2017 at the Festival du film canadien de Dieppe, where it won the Jury Prize and the Espoir du cinéma."Le film «Tadoussac» s’illustre à Namur". Le Devoir, October 6, 2017. It had its Canadian premiere at the Festival du cinéma international en Abitibi-Témiscamingue in October."Première nord-américaine de «Tadoussac»: incursion sur la planète femmes du réalisateur Martin Laroche". Le Devoir, October 30, 2017. Mongeau won the Bayard Award for Best Actress at the Festival International du Film Francophone de Namur, while Blais won the Golden Goblet Award for Best Actress at the 2018 Shanghai International Film Festival"Isabelle Blais récompensée pour le film Tadoussac". Ici Radio-Canada, June 25, 2018. and received a Prix Iris nomination for Best Supporting Actress at the 20th Quebec Cinema Awards."Le problème d’infiltration et Hochelaga : terres des âmes dominent au Gala Québec Cinéma". Ici Radio-Canada, April 10, 2018. ==References== ==External links== * Category:2017 films Category:Canadian films Category:Canadian drama films Category:Côte-Nord Category:Films directed by Martin Laroche Category:Films shot in Quebec Category:Films set in Quebec
